Articles.Content: ASET's with RPM are so sweet! Have a question. Any way I can have in <abbr title="Vehicle Assembly Building">VAB</abbr>, the old CM and redesigned one in 1.4.1?

> 
> 
> On 08/04/2018 at 8:50 PM, Andrey.gr said:
> 
> 
> ASET's with RPM are so sweet! Have a question. Any way I can have in <abbr title="Vehicle Assembly Building">VAB</abbr>, the old CM and redesigned one in 1.4.1?
> 

You can get at the old pod through the Tech Levels part filtering mode. I'd advise backing up all the files for the old pod so you can add it in as a mod yourself (really simple to do - should just be drag and drop to put it back) in the event Squad ever properly remove the old pod rather than just deprecating it.

> 
> 
> 10 hours ago, Sufficient Anonymity said:
> 
> 
> You can get at the old pod through the Tech Levels part filtering mode. I'd advise backing up all the files for the old pod so you can add it in as a mod yourself (really simple to do - should just be drag and drop to put it back) in the event Squad ever properly remove the old pod rather than just deprecating it.
> 

Thank you for your answer.

Do you think we could have the same mod for the Mk 1 Command Pod? Because it's the one mostly used in all early game.. It'll be awesome!

Thanks

Whao, exactly what I was searching, thank you I'll try it soon!
The new interior of 1.4 thing broke the ASET IVA and replaced with the Stock ones, can you fix it?
To enable mk-1-2 pod, go to \ GameData \ Squad \ Parts \ Command \ Mk1-2Pod, open the file mk1-2CommandPod.cfg and change the line category = Pods

Due to me being a noob, does this work with the mk 1-3 pod? Because it isn't.

> 
> 
> 5 hours ago, Xd the great said:
> 
> 
> Due to me being a noob, does this work with the mk 1-3 pod? Because it isn't.
> 

No, you'd need to write a <abbr title="Module Manager (mod)">MM</abbr> patch to switch out the IVA of the Mk1-3 for this (you'll get some clipping issues with the windows, I'd imagine). Alternatively, carry on using the Mk1-2, given it is still accessible via the advanced part sorting modes.

I think the size or tech level filters make it visible.

> 13 hours ago, Xd the great said:
> 
> 
> And also will there be a mod for all the ﻿stock command pods?﻿﻿
> 

Not necessarily - as you can see, different pods have got different modders working on them - there's the Mk1-3 that *akardam* is working on but hasn't released yet, *G'th* has already released an amazing IVA for the Mk3 shuttle cockpit, *theonegalen* is working on a variety of different things, some of which have and haven't been released, plus *alexustas* has made IVAs for other pods which still function fine, like the 1.25m spaceplane cockpit and the small lander can.

![:blink:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_blink.png ":blink:") u right... Future here... it is 1.4.5 Version

For the test, i deleted the Gamedata path (restored to vanilla with steam) and installed ASET Props and RasterPropMonitor on this sequence.

Additionally added the <abbr title="Module Manager (mod)">MM</abbr> (Version  3.0.7) to GameData.

On the Log i see some of errors, like this here:

    LoadInternalPart 'JSI/RPMPodPatches/PatchesMod/orbital-orb-remade-internal/orbitalOrbInternalsRPM' FAILED: Cannot find model
    LoadInternalPart 'JSI/RPMPodPatches/PatchesStock/mk2-sh-cockpit-remade-internal/SH_mk2CockpitInternalRPM' FAILED: Cannot find model
    LoadInternalPart 'JSI/RPMPodPatches/PatchesMod/kp0110-remade-internal/KP0110internalRPM' FAILED: Cannot find model

I think this were the main errors for not loading MK1-2. By the way, i read in one comment, to activate the MK1-2 you have to go in one of the squad paths and edit one of the configurations files of MK1-2 where you set the "category" value from "none" to "Pods". After this the MK1-2 is loadin, but it does not work und looks ugly.

**Edited <time datetime="2018-08-10T11:14:58Z" title="08/10/2018 11:14  AM" data-short="5 yr">August 10, 2018</time> by remax**

Tried it on my own and it works perfectly fine, even though I got the very same error messages like you.

> 
> 
> 4 hours ago, remax said:
> 
> 
> i read in one comment, to activate the MK1-2 you have to go in one of the squad paths and edit one of the configurations files of MK1-2 where you set the "category" value from "none" to "Pods"
> 

You don't <u>have to</u> do this but it becomes easier to find the pod. In the editor, in the top left corner you can see an arrow (looks like 3 vertical lines + a triangle) and if you click on it, you'll enable the advance mode. Every part can be found in this mode by filtering the parts by categories and subcategories. I.e. the MK1-2 pod can be found by filtering by 'cross-section-profile' -> 'size 2 (2.5m)'.

Well, back to your problem:  

Since you already tried reinstalling everything, there is just one more thing I can think of: probably you installed the mods wrong. So, let me draw the required folder structure:

- KSP\_install\_directory
    - GameData
        - ASET
            - ASET\_Props
            - **MK1-2\_IVA\_Replacement\_by\_ASET**
        - JSI
            - Agencies
            - RasterPropMonitor
            - RPMPodPatches
        - Squad
        - SquadExpansion <- This one is optional (DLC)
        - ModuleManager.3.0.7.dll

Thank a lot, sir!
